results.title: Model railroading unlimited
results.creator_credit: Rick Harper, Mike O'Connell and Liberty Pictures
results.brief_description: A young man’s growing interest in his hobby - model railroading - serves as the focus for comedy, intricate and elaborate layouts, and a climatic finale involving several trains running out of control on a super-sized track.

results.title: Mobil movielogue. No. 10
results.brief_description: Documentary film about the various uses of petroleum. Features the Fisherman’s Bend Commonwealth Aircraft factory; shows the manufacturing and testing of Rolls Royce jet engines as used in RAAF Vampire aircraft; the Rover gas turbine car on test tracks; launch of petrol tanker; Altona Refinery opening; Army petrol driven vehicles; speed boats on Sydney Harbour; Bathurst - Mount Panorama circuit in action.

results.title: Moana Roa
results.brief_description: Life among the Polynesian people who inhabit New Zealand’s Cook Islands. The sea plays an important part in the lives of these people; they are expert spear fisherman and gain much of their food from the sea; singing and dancing and also canoe racing are popular pastimes with the islanders. The film reviews health and educational services provided by the administration and mentions the exports of the Islands - copra, oranges, bananas and pineapples.

results.title: Mitosis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines the cellular process of mitosis. Identifies and illustrates the role of the cell nucleus, DNA, chromosomes, chromatids and the centriole in mitosis. Demonstrates the phases of mitosis and explains what happens during each phase. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William L. Claiborne and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Mitosis and mitotic poisons = Mitose und mitosegifte
results.creator_credit: Professor H Lette and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Cultures are grown from the heart of a chicken embryo and the behaviour of the original and subcultures is shown. The process of cell division is photographed at a magnification of 250 and in more detail using oil-immersion at a magnification of 900. The inhibition of mitosis by the presence in the culture medium of various substances is studied. The action which inhibits mitosis varies from an adhesion of the chromosomes which are attempting to divide in the presence of trypaflavin to an explosion of the cells attempting division in the presence of adrenalin. Captions in German.

results.title: Mitosis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows a mitosis actually taking place in a living cell. Demonstrates the effects of chemicals and radiation on dividing cells. Discusses the importance of mitosis to the growth and maintenance of an organism. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Robert Gordon Menzies

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Joseph Benedict Chifley
results.creator_credit: Tom Haydon and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: The life and political career of J.B. Chifley, Prime Minister of Australia 1945-1949. Covers his early life and rise through the ranks of the ALP; notes the record amount of legislation passed furing his term of office, and presents interviews with associates. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary level.
